list_definition.definition: a piece of information spoken or written, passed from one person to another

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I have a message for you from Mr Johnston.

list_definition.definition: the instruction or teaching of a moral story, religion, prophet etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: What message is this story trying to give us?

list_ex_of_english: Caretakers may communicate through contradictory and confused verbal and nonverbal messages.
The entropy of the source defines the amount of the typical messages.
Messages can be addressed to other agents, and there is support in the specifications for connecting individual messages into conversational threads.
Here it is assumed that semantic theory will distinguish among kinds of messages, as indicated.
If people send clear policy messages to elected officials, the behaviour of the latter will be constrained by the preferences of the former.
Moreover, party-sponsored campaign messages are designed explicitly to convince voters that one party is better than the others.
However, future studies offer the potential to compare the effects of, for example, civic duty, neighbourhood solidarity and close election messages.
An alternative to open access is to communicate ontological information directly via an exchange of messages.
